alert.note: Alert for Augusta; Rockingham (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 22 at 12:51PM EST until December 22 at 3:00PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow and sleet accumulations around a coating to an inch in the valleys with 1 to 3 inches along the ridges above 2,000 feet. Ice accumulation ranging from around a trace to a tenth of an inch in the valleys with around a tenth to a quarter inch along the ridges. * WHERE...Augusta and Rockingham Counties. * WHEN...Until 3 PM EST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact holiday travel. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...For the Winter Weather Advisory, precipitation will continue to change to freezing rain this afternoon before eventually changing to rain.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
